static final DateFormat dateISOformat = factoryDateFormat()
 Date format for generating ISO-format dates.

Detailed Description

Various handy utilities - most are static.

Convert a Date to an ISO-standard format. This is thread safe, even though the underlying DateFormat.format() method is not thread safe.

Parameters:

Returns:
string in the format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss

From a list of objects, produce a string with all their elements.

Parameters:

Returns:
list[0].toString() + sep + list[1].toString() + sep + ... + list[list.length].toString()

00174         String sepStr = "";

00176             result.append(sepStr).append(list[i].toString());

static final String com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorUtil::toStringLong (  ArrayList  list,
String  indent,
String  sep
)  [inline, static]
  

00235                                                                                        {
00236         StringBuffer result = new StringBuffer(1000);
00237         String indent2 = indent + "    ";
00238         for (ListIterator it = list.listIterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
00239             Object elem = it.next();
00240             result.append(sep).append(indent);
00241             if (elem instanceof Integer) {
00242                 // result.append("Integer(").append(((Integer)elem).intValue()).append(")");
00243                 result.append(((Integer)elem).intValue());
00244             } else {
00245                 result.append(((ConfigObject)elem).toStringLong(indent2));
00246             }
00247             sep = "\n";
00248         }
00249         if (! list.isEmpty()) {
00250             result.append(sep).append(indent).append("(end ").append(list.get(0).getClass().getName()).append(" list)");
00251         }
00252         return result.toString();
00253     }

static final String com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorUtil::toStringLong (  ConfigObject[]  list,
String  indent,
String  sep
)  [inline, static]
  

00209                                                                                              {
00210         StringBuffer result = new StringBuffer(1000);
00211         String indent2 = indent + "    ";
00212         for (int i = 0; i < list.length; i++) {
00213             result.append(sep).append(indent).append(list[i].toStringLong(indent2));
00214             sep = "\n";
00215         }
00216         if (list.length > 0) {
00217             result.append(sep).append(indent).append("(end ").append(list[0].getClass().getName()).append(" list)");
00218         }
00219         return result.toString();
00220     }
